commit_message:
Change SNMP 'hardware.memory.used' metric to reflect (memTotalReal - memAvailReal) which is the used value for the memory for a physical machine.
This has to be done as SNMP does not provide a memory metric for used that can be directly used.

Change-Id: I3c2be2dee65c278d99144ebf1cd8b0db1adfff6d

commit_message:
Add states required for node-inspection

Adds states INSPECTING and  INSPECTFAIL and their
transitions as required by inspection.

Implements : blueprint ironic-node-properties-discovery

Change-Id: If62173d30785ff19c1d10256788190f8d8c519e3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/57/147857/14 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: INSPECTED = 'inspected' INSPECTING = 'inspecting' INSPECTFAIL = 'inspectfail' MANAGEABLE = 'manageable' AVAILABLE = 'available'machine.add_state(AVAILABLE, **watchers)machine.add_state(MANAGEABLE, target=AVAILABLE, **watchers) machine.add_state(INSPECTED, target=MANAGEABLE, **watchers) machine.add_state(INSPECTING, target=INSPECTED, **watchers) machine.add_state(INSPECTFAIL, **watchers) machine.add_transition(INSPECTING, ERROR, 'error') machine.add_transition(MANAGEABLE, INSPECTING, 'inspect') machine.add_transition(INSPECTING, MANAGEABLE, 'done')

commit_message:
Add clean_exit for py-pgsql unit tests

Currently, py-pgsql env doesn't stop postgresql daemon if
tests fails. In this patchset clean_exit function for postgresql
have been added.

Change-Id: If93d261108b2536ce92e15598a56d6cd8267b1fd
Closes-bug: 1423524
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/50/157350/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: function clean_exit_pgsql(){ ret=$? ${2}/pg_ctl -w -D ${1} -o "-p ${3}" stop rm -rf '${1}' return ${ret} } trap "clean_exit_pgsql ${PGSQL_DATA} ${PGSQL_PATH} ${PGSQL_PORT}" EXIT $*
deleted_lines: $* ret=$? ${PGSQL_PATH}/pg_ctl -w -D ${PGSQL_DATA} -o "-p ${PGSQL_PORT}" stop rm -rf ${PGSQL_DATA} exit ${ret}

Continuing to deliver the refactor discussed during the OSSG mid-cycle.

This change completes the definition of new decorators to be applied
at the plugin/test level.  It also migrates existing tests over to use
one of the new decorators, using checks() instead of the checks_*()
functions.

With the checks_*() decorators we had tried to abstract away from the

value to be had from understanding the AST, so we're removing that
abstraction.

AST nodes they can be executed against.  For example:

@checks('Import', 'ImportFrom')
def random_lib_imports(context):

def ssl_with_bad_version(context, config):
[..]

commit_message:
Further decorator changes and plugin migration

Continuing to deliver the refactor discussed during the OSSG mid-cycle.

This change completes the definition of new decorators to be applied
at the plugin/test level.  It also migrates existing tests over to use
one of the new decorators, using checks() instead of the checks_*()
functions.

With the checks_*() decorators we had tried to abstract away from the
AST nodes.  That was overly-complicating the framework, and there's
value to be had from understanding the AST, so we're removing that
abstraction.

Tests will now be able to use the checks() decorator and include the
AST nodes they can be executed against.  For example:

@checks('Import', 'ImportFrom')
def random_lib_imports(context):
[..]

@checks('Call')
def ssl_with_bad_version(context, config):
[..]

This change also cleans up the definition of additional new decorators
(severity(), category(), title(), uuid()) which future commits will build
out the framework further to utilize.

Change-Id: I32017d21ed897b087ddfc249ebb5b604a9a832fa

deleted_lines: @checks_strings

commit_message:
Utilize polling_interval conf option

The polling_interval CONF option in the agent configuration was not
being utilize.  Instead it had been hardcoded.  This should be utilized
so that administrators have configurability in their polling.

Change-Id: Ib92c6693c820435e7c947140f2f63540d1564eac
Closes-Bug: #1423259

commit_message:
Implements: blueprint update-rabbit-container

Previously, the rabbit container was configured for use in
a k8s cluster. This patch updates the container to run with fig
instead of k8s.

Change-Id: Ie04f2f16771c0f733b7b09b7747325bf0d7fb1a9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/23/157223/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Install required packages RUN yum -y install rabbitmq-server && yum clean all # Run the management plugin RUN /usr/lib/rabbitmq/bin/rabbitmq-plugins enable rabbitmq_management # Copy Rabbit conf files # Copy start-up script # Start Rabbit through the start script
deleted_lines: RUN yum -y install rabbitmq-server; yum clean all

subject: Disentangle tarring in logfiles and increase logging
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-24 11:16:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci/commit/deab6680a8d59ae12a793144b94aa015a08a84fe', 'message': "Disentangle tarring if logfiles for simplicity

We're having problems with some part of creating this tarfile; but
trying to create the tarfile and move it across the network all in one
step is making it difficult to figure out what's going wrong.

This change is intended to be slower and more methodical. Instead of
doing this all at once, we use several SSH commands to create a tempdir;
then to create a tarfile inside it; then to scp that file onto our
working machine; then to unpack it.

This will probably be slower, but should give us more information about
how each step is proceeding - which should in turn enable us to figure
out what's breaking and what we can do about it.

Change-Id: I867869bb516ea70312eaf5f00ec071ad652c44e8
Partial-bug: 1414098
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-01-27 05:36:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci/commit/742ded134ff85930e4a7ca9f2b75da1740c2f727', 'message': "Disentangle tarring in logfiles for simplicity

commit_message:
Disentangle tarring in logfiles and increase logging

We're having problems with some part of creating this tarfile; but
trying to create the tarfile and move it across the network all in one
step is making it difficult to figure out what's going wrong.

This change is intended to be slower and more methodical. Instead of
doing this all at once, we use several SSH commands to create a tempdir;
then to create a tarfile inside it; then to scp that file onto our
working machine; then to unpack it.

This will probably be slower, but should give us more information about
how each step is proceeding - which should in turn enable us to figure
out what's breaking and what we can do about it.

Also increasing our ssh log level to Verbose so we see relevant error
messages when our ssh/scp commands fail.

Change-Id: I867869bb516ea70312eaf5f00ec071ad652c44e8
Partial-bug: 1414098

added_lines: SSH_OPTIONS='-o StrictHostKeyChecking=no \ -o UserKnownHostsFile=/dev/null \ -o LogLevel=QUIET \ -o PasswordAuthentication=no' TEMPDIR=$(ssh ${SSH_OPTIONS} $2 mktemp -d) REMOTE_FILENAME=$TEMPDIR/$1_logs.tar.xz MKTAR_CMD='( set -x; export PATH=$PATH:/sbin ps -efZ; ls -Z /var/run/; df -h; uptime; sudo netstat -lpn; sudo iptables-save; sudo ovs-vsctl show; ip addr; free -h; dpkg -l || rpm -qa; sudo os-collect-config --print; ) 2>&1 | sudo dd of=/var/log/host_info.txt &> /dev/null; sudo XZ_OPT=-3 tar -cJf $REMOTE_FILENAME \ --exclude=udev/hwdb.bin \ --exclude=selinux/targeted \ --exclude=etc/services \ --exclude=etc/pki \ /var/log /etc /mnt/state/var/log' ssh ${SSH_OPTIONS} $2 "${MKTAR_CMD}" scp ${SSH_OPTIONS} $2:$REMOTE_FILENAME $WORKSPACE/logs/$1_logs.tar.gz
deleted_lines: SSH_CMD='( set -x; export PATH=$PATH:/sbin ps -efZ; ls -Z /var/run/; df -h; uptime; sudo netstat -lpn; sudo iptables-save; sudo ovs-vsctl show; ip addr; free -h; dpkg -l || rpm -qa; sudo os-collect-config --print; ) 2>&1 | sudo dd of=/var/log/host_info.txt &> /dev/null; sudo XZ_OPT=-3 tar -cJf - \ --exclude=udev/hwdb.bin \ --exclude=selinux/targeted \ --exclude=etc/services \ --exclude=etc/pki \ /var/log /etc /mnt/state/var/log || true' ssh -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no \ -o UserKnownHostsFile=/dev/null \ -o LogLevel=QUIET \ -o PasswordAuthentication=no $2 \ "${SSH_CMD}" > $WORKSPACE/logs/$1_logs.tar.xz

commit_message:
For flake8 check, make the 'E12' ignore be more granular

ignore = E12 means ignore E12* errors.

Make it more granular by converting to E121,E122,...,E129

This will make it easier in the future to remove a single ignore and
update the code to resolve the issues.

Change-Id: Iddff6a826bc7c9ff07643b7408c51f1bd129530c

commit_message:
Don't assume contents of values after aggregate_update

aggregate_update() was explicitly setting values['metadata'] for the
caller. However, it has also popped availability_zone, which it
doesn't replace. Also, other _update() functions in the db api don't
do this after modifying values in place, so anything which assumed
this behaviour would be inconsistent.

The only code which did assume this behaviour was in a test. This
patch fixes the test.

Change-Id: Iaa21576655da037e6186e900234e2c29c9e3a652

commit_message:
Run tempest tests with testr

The primary reason for this is that test skips exceptions are
interpreted as skips not errors.

A secondary benefit is that testr revolves around tasks lists so we can
fine tune the task list without modifying tempest code.

Related:
  * XML tests failing: https://github.com/rcbops/ansible-lxc-rpc/issues/653
  * Tempest Testing: https://github.com/rcbops/ansible-lxc-rpc/issues/472

Conflicts:
        rpc_deployment/roles/tempest/files/rpc_tempest_gate.sh

Change-Id: I4edb1f9775ff4b1e5f07e40ace40f028c847edeb
(cherry picked from commit 8cac8689d565b0362af7826447d29a1e927953ea)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/17/157317/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # work in tempest directory # read creds into environment# create testr trepo - required for testr to do anything testr init &>/dev/null ||: # Get list of available tests testr list-tests > full_test_list # filter test list to produce list of tests to use. egrep 'tempest\.api\.(identity|image|volume)' < full_test_list \ |grep -vi xml \ > test_list # execute chosen tests with pretty output ./run_tempest.sh --no-virtual-env -- --load-list test_list; result=$? if [[ $result == 0 ]]; then echo "GATE PASS" else echo "GATE FAIL" fi exit $result
deleted_lines: set -eAPI_TESTS="identity" for project in $API_TESTS do echo "Running API tests for $project" nosetests -v tempest/api/$project done echo "GATE PASS"

commit_message:
Implements: blueprint heat-fig-update

Fig is initially being evaluated to provide container set
functionality. Therefore, the heat template needs to be updated
to support running fig on Kolla nodes. This patch adds the
required directories, files, and commands to run fig and a
RabbitMQ container for testing.

Change-Id: Ifad399b43d8ca712a5efbdafe945d055c33b1e77
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/17/157217/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Directory where the fig container reads yaml files mkdir -p /opt/docker-compose # Sample yaml file for testing cat << EOF > /opt/docker-compose/docker-compose.yml rabbitmq: image: kollaglue/fedora-rdo-rabbitmq environment: RABBITMQ_NODENAME: rabbit01 RABBITMQ_USER: rabbit RABBITMQ_PASS: password net: "host" ports: - "5672:5672" - "15672:15672" - "4369:4369" - "25672:25672" privileged: true EOF # Pull the fig image docker pull kollaglue/fedora-rdo-docker-compose # Up the RabbitMQ test container-set docker run --privileged -v /opt/docker-compose:/opt/docker-compose \ -v /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock \ kollaglue/fedora-rdo-docker-compose up -d

commit_message:
First pass at VIOS VLAN Provision

This change set provides a first pass of function needed to provision a
VLAN on the VIOS.  Uses the API in pypowervm to enable this.

This change does not remove the vlan off the system.

Change-Id: I246564e8270807791c7b28f26dbea297a74e0af4

commit_message:
Support for alembic cells v2 db migrations

Added the standard alembic commands to nova-manage for managing the api
database.  Includes an autogenerated alembic migration based on the
model that was added.

Change-Id: I6d07bb9e5b138f658476307ad1ed42a431c8863d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/66/153666/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from __future__ import with_statement from alembic import context from sqlalchemy import engine_from_config, pool from logging.config import fileConfig # this is the Alembic Config object, which provides # access to the values within the .ini file in use. config = context.config # Interpret the config file for Python logging. # This line sets up loggers basically. fileConfig(config.config_file_name) # add your model's MetaData object here # for 'autogenerate' support # from myapp import mymodel # target_metadata = mymodel.Base.metadata target_metadata = None # other values from the config, defined by the needs of env.py, # can be acquired: # my_important_option = config.get_main_option("my_important_option") # ... etc. def run_migrations_offline(): """Run migrations in 'offline' mode. This configures the context with just a URL and not an Engine, though an Engine is acceptable here as well. By skipping the Engine creation we don't even need a DBAPI to be available. Calls to context.execute() here emit the given string to the script output. """ url = config.get_main_option("sqlalchemy.url") context.configure(url=url, target_metadata=target_metadata) with context.begin_transaction(): context.run_migrations() def run_migrations_online(): """Run migrations in 'online' mode. In this scenario we need to create an Engine and associate a connection with the context. """ engine = engine_from_config( config.get_section(config.config_ini_section), prefix='sqlalchemy.', poolclass=pool.NullPool) connection = engine.connect() context.configure( connection=connection, target_metadata=target_metadata ) try: with context.begin_transaction(): context.run_migrations() finally: connection.close() if context.is_offline_mode(): run_migrations_offline() else: run_migrations_online()

commit_message:
Policy enforcement functional tests - scripts

Shell scripts preparing dsvm environment for policy enforcement tests.
Tests require devstack with Congress installed.
Some original scripts where changed to reuse functionality.
Jenkins job https://review.openstack.org/#/c/150401/

Partially Implements blueprint congress-support-in-murano

Change-Id: Ib3c26168043f74d4e7ec76f3557f8857cf4304a4

remove python-openstackclient

I'm pretty sure there is no valid reason for this to be in here and it
was only added to let it be installed in devstack when this list
controlled the pypi mirrors.

commit_message:
Fix usage drop_constraint in 2a1ee2fb59e0 migration

Downgrade for migration 2a1ee2fb59e0_add_mac_address_unique_constraint
fails as it gets wrong parameters name, source and local_cols,
although it expects name, source and type_.

Also as MySQL creates index for unique constraint it should be used
"with migration.remove_fks_from_table".

Closes-bug: #1421631

Change-Id: Id86b2f339a6fb33fc4fd637ffbfc2cb6e75ef4fb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/37/155737/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron.db import migration with migration.remove_fks_from_table(TABLE_NAME): op.drop_constraint( CONSTRAINT_NAME, TABLE_NAME, type_='unique' )
deleted_lines: op.drop_constraint( name=CONSTRAINT_NAME, source=TABLE_NAME, local_cols=['network_id', 'mac_address'] )

commit_message:
Combining sec groups member update RPC calls

This change allows combining multiple RPC calls for
security group member/provider updates that are needed
as a result of create bulk port operations.

Change-Id: Ibfe84f40e55a9847cbcaa4a7344988b2d3fb895e
Closes-Bug: #1373634

subject: Fix VNC access, when reverse DNS lookups fail
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-16 11:55:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/b7e242027de4fcc4635cd79d041bfe08e1558852', 'message': "Fix VNC access, when reverse DNS lookups fail

If DNS is configured on a node in a way, so that reverse DNS look ups
time out, noVNC will fail to connect to an instance with 'Connect
timeout' error.

The reverse DNS look up is done implicitly in BaseHTTPRequestHandler
(part of standard library), when logging a request. It's not
configurable, so the only way to disable it is to override the method
of the base class.

This is only true for the standard http server (used for novncproxy),
as the eventlet implementation (used for xvpvncproxy) seems to use
plain IP addresses without any reverse DNS look ups.

Closes-Bug: #1422315

of the base class.

as the eventlet implementation (used for xvpvncproxy) seems to use

commit_message:
Fix VNC access, when reverse DNS lookups fail

If DNS is configured on a node in a way, so that reverse DNS look ups
time out, noVNC will fail to connect to an instance with 'Connect
timeout' error.

The reverse DNS look up is done implicitly in BaseHTTPRequestHandler
(part of standard library), when logging a request. It's not
configurable, so the only way to disable it is to override the method
of the base class.

This is only true for the standard http server (used for novncproxy),
as the eventlet implementation (used for xvpvncproxy) seems to use
plain IP addresses without any reverse DNS look ups.

Closes-Bug: #1422315

Change-Id: I8b922de49134eda4d753a8e906b0de55203877d3

added_lines: def address_string(self): # NOTE(rpodolyaka): override the superclass implementation here and # explicitly disable the reverse DNS lookup, which might fail on some # deployments due to DNS configuration and break VNC access completely return str(self.client_address[0])

commit_message:
Support live-migrate of instances in PAUSED state

Live migration enables one to migrate an active VM that consumes
system resources such as memory and CPU.

Nova currently allows only those in ACTIVE vm_state to migrate.  This
patch adds support for PAUSED vm_state. Essentially a paused state is
identical to a running state except the stopped CPUs.

Co-Author: "Matthew Gilliard <matthew.gilliard@hp.com>"

Partial-Bug: #1305062
Change-Id: Ib38eaf412cb51a9cbfc443c5ec15c5797265ddae

added_lines: inst['power_state'] = power_state.RUNNING self.compute._instance_update(c, instance['uuid'], host=src_host, task_state=None, expected_task_state=task_states.MIGRATING).AndReturn( updated_instance) def _pause_instance(self, instance, params=None): instance_uuid = instance['uuid'] self.assertEqual(instance['vm_state'], vm_states.ACTIVE) self.assertEqual(instance['power_state'], power_state.RUNNING) instance.task_state = task_states.PAUSING instance.save(expected_task_state=None) self.compute.pause_instance(self.context, instance) instance = db.instance_get_by_uuid(self.context, instance_uuid) self.assertIsNone(instance['task_state']) self.assertEqual(instance['vm_state'], vm_states.PAUSED) def test_live_migrate_active_other(self): instance, instance_uuid = self._run_instance() instance = self._objectify(instance) self._pause_instance(instance) rpcapi = self.compute_api.compute_task_api self.mox.StubOutWithMock(rpcapi, 'live_migrate_instance') rpcapi.live_migrate_instance(self.context, instance, 'fake_dest_host', block_migration=True, disk_over_commit=True) self.mox.ReplayAll() self.compute_api.live_migrate(self.context, instance, block_migration=True, disk_over_commit=True, host_name='fake_dest_host') instance.refresh() self.assertEqual(instance['task_state'], task_states.MIGRATING)

commit_message:
Pass the capabilities to ironic node instance_info

This commit is to pass on the `capabilities` defined in `extra-spec`
key of the flavor to node's instance_info field. It copies the
key and value pair to the instance_info without any manipulation
in the value.

Implements : blueprint pass-flavor-capabilities-to-ironic-virt-driver

DocImpact

Change-Id: Id8ae681ce69f66da4b6579c40aff8d2eda96666d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/12/141012/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: capabilities = {} for key, val in extra_specs.iteritems(): cap_key=key.split(':') if cap_key[0] == 'capabilities': capabilities[cap_key[1]]=val if capabilities is not None: patch.append({'path': '/instance_info/capabilities', 'op': 'add', 'value': capabilities})

commit_message:
libvirt: cleanup setattr usage in test_host

There is some suspect setattr/delattr in test_host for mocking out
VIR_CONNECT_BASELINE_CPU_EXPAND_FEATURES. This can be easily stubbed out
with mock and the create=True kwarg so we can remove the setattr
ugliness.

Note that if you decorate a test method with a mock and use the new
kwarg, the stub isn't passed as an argument to the test method.

Change-Id: I414ac96b089f297c35fa821b926546290ac66bdc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/63/156263/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch.object(host.libvirt, 'VIR_CONNECT_BASELINE_CPU_EXPAND_FEATURES', new=1, create=True) def test_baseline_cpu_not_supported(self): @mock.patch.object(libvirt, 'VIR_CONNECT_BASELINE_CPU_EXPAND_FEATURES', new=1, create=True)
deleted_lines: def test_baseline_cpu_not_supported(self): # `mock` has trouble stubbing attributes that don't exist yet, so # fallback to plain-Python attribute setting/deleting cap_str = 'VIR_CONNECT_BASELINE_CPU_EXPAND_FEATURES' if not hasattr(host.libvirt, cap_str): setattr(host.libvirt, cap_str, True) self.addCleanup(delattr, host.libvirt, cap_str) setattr(libvirt, 'VIR_CONNECT_BASELINE_CPU_EXPAND_FEATURES', 1) delattr(libvirt, 'VIR_CONNECT_BASELINE_CPU_EXPAND_FEATURES')

where fakelibvirt isn't used if a real libvirt is in the environment,
but if the version of libvirt is old enough that it doesn't have the

Change-Id: Ib8098131b564934c0e96b4dda71c6810054f3d73

commit_message:
libvirt: add TODOs for removing libvirt attribute stubs

This goes through and adds TODOs to several stubs set in libvirt tests
where fakelibvirt isn't used if a real libvirt is in the environment,
but if the version of libvirt is old enough that it doesn't have the
attributes, the tests fail with AttributeError. These are markers to
cleanup once we've removed the ability to test against a real libvirt in
the *unit* tests and rely on fakelibvirt only.

Note that there are a couple of tests were attributes are explicitly set
to test negative cases, e.g. setting VIR_DOMAIN_XML_MIGRATABLE to None
for workaround flows in the driver code with older libvirts during
migrations.

This also adds the constants VIR_DOMAIN_XML_UPDATE_CPU and
VIR_DOMAIN_XML_MIGRATABLE to fakelibvirt to prepare for an eventual
cutover to fakelibvirt only tests.

Related-Bug: #1422385

Change-Id: Ib8098131b564934c0e96b4dda71c6810054f3d73
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/04/156804/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fixes Attribute Error when trying to spawn instance from vhd on HyperV

When trying to boot an instance from a vhd image we get a AttributeError.
This happens when we try to get the root disk size from the old flavor.
Since on creation there is no old flavor, instance.get_flavor() will return
None and thus the AttributeError when trying to return te root_gb.

This patch fixes this problem by checking if the return value from
instance.get_flavor() is None, in which case it returns
instance.root_gb.

Change-Id: Ief16679a6b80f6f8b9246ea6a50773e40824bb7f
Closes-Bug: 1421272

added_lines: old_flavor = instance.get_flavor('old') if old_flavor: else: return instance.root_gb

commit_message:
Fix return value inconsistency in VNX Driver

When iscsi_initiators option for EMC Cinder Driver has no value,
a dict object is returned by find_available_iscsi_targets() in
EMC Cinder Driver while a list is expected. Thus an
initialize_connection() will fail due to the inconsistency.

This patch is to fix this inconsistency in the driver.

Change-Id: I094340cc60da4a8b423233983a1d00784bbbb8ea
Closes-Bug: 1422563

commit_message:
WIP start adding gabbi tests to gnocchi

This doesn't cover everything yet, I'm posting it just to get some
first glance review and sanity checking on how I'm doing the database
setup.

The gabbi tests are integrated with the other tests such that
existing tox targets will call them. This requires making
a ConfigFixture that each gabbi yaml file uses. The upshot of this
is that database and conf handling is per file and relatively
clear cut. The fixture will clean up created databases and temp
files.

It is also possible to run the gabbi tests with their own tox
target: tox -epy27-gabbi.

There are three test files thus far:

* base.yaml requests / and makes sure there is a world
* archive.yaml covers some basic archive policy handling
* resource.yaml starts investigating resource handling.
* metric.yaml starts investigating metric handling.

xfails are used where necessary to ride over bad behavior.

A file-based storage engine is started from the ConfigFixture.

Change-Id: Ic09743af5a19c04cecf28bbc1a42e841e142b600

commit_message:
Add aliases "rally task|deployment|verify use"

Add alias "rally task use" for "rally use task",
"rally deployment use" for "rally use deployment"
and "rally verify use" for "rally use verification"

Change-Id: I6e63f4b60e1faf794f050f98be127744fe8011a4

commit_message:
Steps 'hiera' and 'globals' are requiring for all roles

Without it base-os nodes could not run post-deployment hooks,
for example: hosts.

Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Ilyin <dilyin@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I6ed5023bb8dca64ecf456a081a57b7b8d283e330
Closes-Bug: #1422364

commit_message:
Skip tag and push if tag exists

Even though the sanity-checking script reports existing tags,
we still need to look for that condition in oslo_release.sh
and skip the git operations, since they will fail.

Change-Id: Icd86bf90b4bcc4f5349e16fd52d3d2011e30c2c9

added_lines: if git show-ref "$VERSION" then echo "$PROJECT already has a version $VERSION tag" else echo "Tag message is '$TAGMSG'" git tag -m "$TAGMSG" -s "$VERSION" $TARGETSHA git push gerrit $VERSION fi

commit_message:
Add mode for fake_tasks, fixes hanging task

override_state is added, it makes all tasks created with fake_tasks using
this option fix themselves on 50 progress and 'running' status.

test_rerun_stopped_deploy uses above option for first deploy, which is
meant to be stopped, but couldn't be run in a manner that guarantees
that stop task will be fast enough to stop the deploy.

godmode is replaced by override_state with appropriate parameters

Change-Id: Ie00e3845b8bb2273ce9857b789071705c81d2b34
Closes-Bug: #1419046

commit_message:
Rename volume_type to share_type

This change renames support for volume_type to share_type.
The manila client will send data to Manila API using share_type, but
passes both share_type and volume_type values returned from API call to users
of the python binding; however, CLI output will only print the value of
share_type. This change ensures that --volume-type (and its other
permutations) are aliases of --share-type, thus providing backwards
compatibility for command line arguments of the shell.

Change-Id: Id40eea27c2c5b44e1d01c061a48e1658ba800f43
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-manilaclient refs/changes/20/149720/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import argparse '--share-type', metavar='<share-type>', help='Optional share type. (Default=None)', default=None) @cliutils.arg( help=argparse.SUPPRESS, share_type = None # share type should take precendence if both are specified if args.volume_type: share_type = args.volume_type if args.share_type: share_type = args.share_type share_type=share_type)
deleted_lines: help='Optional volume type. (Default=None)', volume_type=args.volume_type)

subject: Convert existing roles into galaxy roles
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-04 01:00:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/32722ccae696f35fcc04c1d8200f3ffbdd1dd2c7', 'message': '[WIP] Generize all roles and plays

This change implements the blueprint to genereize all roles and plays
that Rackspace private cloud originally created for use within the
Rackspace private cloud product. As this is now a community project
all of the Rackspace specific bits have been removed and all of the
roles have been changed over to use a more generic setup following
upstream ansible best practices.

Items Changed:
* The base `rpc_deployment` directory and the psuedo structure created
  in that directory has been falttened. All playbooks exist within the
  playbooks directory and the coresponding roles are in the roles
  directory.
* All tasks have tags.
* All roles use namespaced variables.
* All redundant tasks within a given play and role have been removed.
* All of the repetitive plays have been removed in-favor of a more
  simplistic approach. This change duplicates code within the roles but
  ensures that the roles only ever run within their own scope.
* All roles have been built using an anasible galaxy syntax.
* The gating job scripts have been built so a user can run simple playbook
  lint and syntax checks with minimal effort or kick an "all in one"
  infrastructure that is development ready.
* The `*requirement.txt` files have been reformatted follow upstream
  Openstack practices.
* Dynamically generated inventory is now more organized, this should assist
  anyone who may want or need to dive into the JSON blob that is created.
  In the inventory a properties field is used for items that customize containers
  within the inventory.
* The environment map has been modified to support additional host groups to
  enable the seperation of infrastructure pieces. While the old infra_hosts group
  will still work this change allows for groups to be divided up into seperate
  chunks; IE deployment of a swift only stack.
* The LXC logic now exists within the plays.

Items Excised:
* `rpc-maas` was completely removed from the repo.
* `rpc-support` was completely removed from the repo.
* All of the roles have had the LXC logic removed from within them which
  should allow people to consume the roles outside of our reference
  architecture.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1403676
Implements: Convert existing roles into galaxy roles
Change-Id: I03df3328b7655f0cc9e43ba83b02623d038d214e

that Rackspace private cloud originally created for use within the
Rackspace private cloud product. As this is now a community project
all of the Rackspace specific bits have been removed and all of the
roles have been changed over to use a more generic setup following
upstream ansible best practices.

Items Changed:
* The base `rpc_deployment` directory and the psuedo structure created
  in that directory has been falttened. All playbooks exist within the
  playbooks directory and the coresponding roles are in the roles
  directory.
* All tasks have tags.
* All roles use namespaced variables.
* All redundant tasks within a given play and role have been removed.
* All of the repetitive plays have been removed in-favor of a more
  simplistic approach. This change duplicates code within the roles but
  ensures that the roles only ever run within their own scope.
* All roles have been built using an anasible galaxy syntax.
* The gating job scripts have been built so a user can run simple playbook
  lint and syntax checks with minimal effort or kick an "all in one"

  In the inventory a properties field is used for items that customize containers
  within the inventory.

  enable the seperation of infrastructure pieces. While the old infra_hosts group
  will still work this change allows for groups to be divided up into seperate
  chunks; IE deployment of a swift only stack.

* The `*requirement.txt` files have been reformatted follow upstream
  Openstack practices.
* Dynamically generated inventory is now more organized, this should assist
  anyone who may want or need to dive into the JSON blob that is created.
  In the inventory a properties field is used for items that customize containers
  within the inventory.
* The environment map has been modified to support additional host groups to
  enable the seperation of infrastructure pieces. While the old infra_hosts group
  will still work this change allows for groups to be divided up into seperate
  chunks; IE deployment of a swift only stack.
* The LXC logic now exists within the plays.

Items Excised:
* All variables that started with `rpc_.*`, `opc_.*`, or `rackspace_.*` that were
  not completely removed have been renamed to `openstack_.*`.
* `rpc-maas` was completely removed from the repo.
* `rpc-support` was completely removed from the repo.
* All of the roles have had the LXC logic removed from within them which
  should allow people to consume the roles outside of our reference
  architecture.

Note:
* the directory rpc_deployment still exists and is presently pointed at plays
  containing a deprecation warning instructing the user to move to the standard
  playbooks directory.
* While all of the rackspace specific components and variables have been removed
  and or were refactored the repository still relies on an upstream mirror of
  Openstack built python files and container images. This upstream mirror is hosted
  at rackspace at "http://rpc-repo.rackspace.com" though this is
  not locked to and or tied to rackspace specific installations. This repository
  contains all of the needed code to create and or clone your own mirror.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1403676
Implements: Convert existing roles into galaxy roles
Change-Id: I03df3328b7655f0cc9e43ba83b02623d038d214e

This change implements the blueprint to genereize all roles and plays
that Rackspace private cloud originally created for use within the
Rackspace private cloud product. All of the roles have been changed
over to use a more generic setup following upstream ansible best
practices.

Items Changed:
* All tasks have tags.
* All roles use namespaced variables.
* All redundant tasks within a given play and role have been removed.
* All of the repetitive plays have been removed in-favor of a more
  simplistic approach. This change duplicates code within the roles but
  ensures that the roles only ever run within their own scope.
* All roles have been built using an ansible galaxy syntax.
* The `*requirement.txt` files have been reformatted follow upstream
  Openstack practices.
* Dynamically generated inventory is now more organized, this should assist
  anyone who may want or need to dive into the JSON blob that is created.
  In the inventory a properties field is used for items that customize containers
  within the inventory.
* The environment map has been modified to support additional host groups to
  enable the seperation of infrastructure pieces. While the old infra_hosts group

  chunks; IE deployment of a swift only stack.

  should allow roles to be consumed outside of the `os-ansible-deployment`

Note:
* the directory rpc_deployment still exists and is presently pointed at plays
  containing a deprecation warning instructing the user to move to the standard
  playbooks directory.

  and or were refactored the repository still has dependencies on an upstream mirror of

  for some of the cached items and download-able images these roles are not tied to that
  specific repository. This commit adds in the a frozen repo within the infrastructure.
  The addition of the repo bits provides all of the needed code to create and or clone 
  your own mirror.
* The AIO gate scripts have been changed to deploy multiple of some container types such 
  that they are testing clustering of items like Galera, RabbitMQ, Keystone, the frozen
  Repository, and Horizon.

This change implements the blueprint to convert all roles and plays into
a more generic setup, following upstream ansible best practices.

Items Changed:
* All tasks have tags.
* All roles use namespaced variables.
* All redundant tasks within a given play and role have been removed.
* All of the repetitive plays have been removed in-favor of a more

  within the inventory.

  enable the seperation of infrastructure pieces. While the old infra_hosts group
  will still work this change allows for groups to be divided up into seperate
  chunks; eg: deployment of a swift only stack.
* The LXC logic now exists within the plays.
* etc/openstack_deploy/user_variables.yml has all password/token
  variables extracted into the separate file
  etc/openstack_deploy/user_secrets.yml in order to allow seperate
  security settings on that file.

* All of the roles have had the LXC logic removed from within them which
  should allow roles to be consumed outside of the `os-ansible-deployment`
  reference architecture.

  enable the seperation of infrastructure pieces. While the old infra_hosts group
  will still work this change allows for groups to be divided up into seperate
  chunks; eg: deployment of a swift only stack.
* The LXC logic now exists within the plays.
* etc/openstack_deploy/user_variables.yml has all password/token
  variables extracted into the separate file
  etc/openstack_deploy/user_secrets.yml in order to allow seperate
  security settings on that file.

Items Excised:
* All of the roles have had the LXC logic removed from within them which
  should allow roles to be consumed outside of the `os-ansible-deployment`
  reference architecture.

Note:
* the directory rpc_deployment still exists and is presently pointed at plays
  containing a deprecation warning instructing the user to move to the standard
  playbooks directory.
* While all of the rackspace specific components and variables have been removed
  and or were refactored the repository still relies on an upstream mirror of
  Openstack built python files and container images. This upstream mirror is hosted
  at rackspace at "http://rpc-repo.rackspace.com" though this is
  not locked to and or tied to rackspace specific installations. This repository
  contains all of the needed code to create and/or clone your own mirror.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1403676
Implements: blueprint galaxy-roles
Change-Id: I03df3328b7655f0cc9e43ba83b02623d038d214e

This change implements the blueprint to convert all roles and plays into
a more generic setup, following upstream ansible best practices.

Items Changed:
* All tasks have tags.
* All roles use namespaced variables.
* All redundant tasks within a given play and role have been removed.
* All of the repetitive plays have been removed in-favor of a more
  simplistic approach. This change duplicates code within the roles but
  ensures that the roles only ever run within their own scope.
* All roles have been built using an ansible galaxy syntax.
* The `*requirement.txt` files have been reformatted follow upstream
  Openstack practices.
* Dynamically generated inventory is now more organized, this should assist
  anyone who may want or need to dive into the JSON blob that is created.
  In the inventory a properties field is used for items that customize containers
  within the inventory.
* The environment map has been modified to support additional host groups to
  enable the seperation of infrastructure pieces. While the old infra_hosts group
  will still work this change allows for groups to be divided up into seperate
  chunks; eg: deployment of a swift only stack.
* The LXC logic now exists within the plays.
* etc/openstack_deploy/user_variables.yml has all password/token
  variables extracted into the separate file
  etc/openstack_deploy/user_secrets.yml in order to allow seperate
  security settings on that file.

Items Excised:
* All of the roles have had the LXC logic removed from within them which
  should allow roles to be consumed outside of the `os-ansible-deployment`
  reference architecture.

Note:
* the directory rpc_deployment still exists and is presently pointed at plays
  containing a deprecation warning instructing the user to move to the standard
  playbooks directory.
* While all of the rackspace specific components and variables have been removed
  and or were refactored the repository still relies on an upstream mirror of
  Openstack built python files and container images. This upstream mirror is hosted
  at rackspace at "http://rpc-repo.rackspace.com" though this is
  not locked to and or tied to rackspace specific installations. This repository
  contains all of the needed code to create and/or clone your own mirror.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1403676
Implements: blueprint galaxy-roles
Change-Id: I03df3328b7655f0cc9e43ba83b02623d038d214e

'}, {'number': 29, 'created': '2015-02-18 03:25:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/a5779afeaf431549ff976640207ed302b528d5fb', 'message': 'Generize all roles and plays

This change implements the blueprint to genereize all roles and plays
that Rackspace private cloud originally created for use within the
Rackspace private cloud product. All of the roles have been changed
over to use a more generic setup following upstream ansible best
practices.

Items Changed:
* All tasks have tags.
* All roles use namespaced variables.
* All redundant tasks within a given play and role have been removed.
* All of the repetitive plays have been removed in-favor of a more
  simplistic approach. This change duplicates code within the roles but
  ensures that the roles only ever run within their own scope.
* All roles have been built using an anasible galaxy syntax.
* The `*requirement.txt` files have been reformatted follow upstream
  Openstack practices.
* Dynamically generated inventory is now more organized, this should assist
  anyone who may want or need to dive into the JSON blob that is created.
  In the inventory a properties field is used for items that customize containers
  within the inventory.
* The environment map has been modified to support additional host groups to
  enable the seperation of infrastructure pieces. While the old infra_hosts group
  will still work this change allows for groups to be divided up into seperate
  chunks; IE deployment of a swift only stack.
* The LXC logic now exists within the plays.

Items Excised:
* All of the roles have had the LXC logic removed from within them which
  should allow roles to be consumed outside of the `os-ansible-deployment`
  reference architecture.

Note:
* the directory rpc_deployment still exists and is presently pointed at plays
  containing a deprecation warning instructing the user to move to the standard
  playbooks directory.
* While all of the rackspace specific components and variables have been removed
  and or were refactored the repository still relies on an upstream mirror of
  Openstack built python files and container images. This upstream mirror is hosted
  at rackspace at "http://rpc-repo.rackspace.com" though this is
  not locked to and or tied to rackspace specific installations. This repository
  contains all of the needed code to create and or clone your own mirror.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1403676
Implements: blueprint galaxy-roles
Change-Id: I03df3328b7655f0cc9e43ba83b02623d038d214e
'}, {'number': 30, 'created': '2015-02-18 10:51:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/69401f977d8db9bfdfc60238c1a6f996a23a968e', 'message': 'Convert existing roles into galaxy roles

roles into galaxy roles

This change implements the blueprint to convert all roles and plays into
a more generic setup, following upstream ansible best practices.

Items Changed:
* All tasks have tags.
* All roles use namespaced variables.
* All redundant tasks within a given play and role have been removed.

  simplistic approach. This change duplicates code within the roles but
  ensures that the roles only ever run within their own scope.

* The `*requirement.txt` files have been reformatted follow upstream
  Openstack practices.
* Dynamically generated inventory is now more organized, this should assist
  anyone who may want or need to dive into the JSON blob that is created.
  In the inventory a properties field is used for items that customize containers
  within the inventory.

  variables extracted into the separate file
  etc/openstack_deploy/user_secrets.yml in order to allow seperate
  security settings on that file.

Items Excised:
* All of the roles have had the LXC logic removed from within them which
  should allow roles to be consumed outside of the `os-ansible-deployment`
  reference architecture.

Note:
* the directory rpc_deployment still exists and is presently pointed at plays
  containing a deprecation warning instructing the user to move to the standard
  playbooks directory.
* While all of the rackspace specific components and variables have been removed
  and or were refactored the repository still relies on an upstream mirror of
  Openstack built python files and container images. This upstream mirror is hosted
  at rackspace at "http://rpc-repo.rackspace.com" though this is
  not locked to and or tied to rackspace specific installations. This repository
  contains all of the needed code to create and/or clone your own mirror.

DocImpact

Closes-Bug: #1403676

Change-Id: I03df3328b7655f0cc9e43ba83b02623d038d214e
'}]
commit_message:
Convert existing roles into galaxy roles

This change implements the blueprint to convert all roles and plays into
a more generic setup, following upstream ansible best practices.

Items Changed:
* All tasks have tags.
* All roles use namespaced variables.
* All redundant tasks within a given play and role have been removed.
* All of the repetitive plays have been removed in-favor of a more
  simplistic approach. This change duplicates code within the roles but
  ensures that the roles only ever run within their own scope.
* All roles have been built using an ansible galaxy syntax.
* The `*requirement.txt` files have been reformatted follow upstream
  Openstack practices.
* Dynamically generated inventory is now more organized, this should assist
  anyone who may want or need to dive into the JSON blob that is created.
  In the inventory a properties field is used for items that customize containers
  within the inventory.
* The environment map has been modified to support additional host groups to
  enable the seperation of infrastructure pieces. While the old infra_hosts group
  will still work this change allows for groups to be divided up into seperate
  chunks; eg: deployment of a swift only stack.
* The LXC logic now exists within the plays.
* etc/openstack_deploy/user_variables.yml has all password/token
  variables extracted into the separate file
  etc/openstack_deploy/user_secrets.yml in order to allow seperate
  security settings on that file.

Items Excised:
* All of the roles have had the LXC logic removed from within them which
  should allow roles to be consumed outside of the `os-ansible-deployment`
  reference architecture.

Note:
* the directory rpc_deployment still exists and is presently pointed at plays
  containing a deprecation warning instructing the user to move to the standard
  playbooks directory.
* While all of the rackspace specific components and variables have been removed
  and or were refactored the repository still relies on an upstream mirror of
  Openstack built python files and container images. This upstream mirror is hosted
  at rackspace at "http://rpc-repo.rackspace.com" though this is
  not locked to and or tied to rackspace specific installations. This repository
  contains all of the needed code to create and/or clone your own mirror.

DocImpact
Co-Authored-By: Jesse Pretorius <jesse.pretorius@rackspace.co.uk>
Closes-Bug: #1403676
Implements: blueprint galaxy-roles
Change-Id: I03df3328b7655f0cc9e43ba83b02623d038d214e

commit_message:
remove the Conf.signing.token_format option support

In the doc string, it clearly states that we ensure backwards
compatibility for Conf.signing.token_format until Havana + 2.
Now, we are in the Kilo development cycle, we can remove this
support.

partially-implements blueprint removed-as-of-kilo
Closes-Bug: #1406172
Change-Id: I3cd1e2e5a51c4a87edf00647bc1b95a0347e3316

deleted_lines: self.assertRaises(exception.UnexpectedError, token.provider.Manager.get_token_provider)

commit_message:
Reduce galera gcache size for commit check on AIO

This patch reduces the galera cache size for the AIO configuration in
order to improve the success of tempest tests on a low memory instance.

Conflicts:
        scripts/gate-check-commit.sh

Co-Authored-By: Hugh Saunders <hugh@wherenow.org>
Partial-Bug: #1419094
Change-Id: I837abe7d53a862e2b3838f66f9cc90d4eb02fafd
(cherry picked from commit 3f9ffe11159a3c8fd0094f0c9a03a21bbe2eee29)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/36/157236/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Generate random passwords and tokens # Reduce galera gcache size in an attempt to fit into an 8GB cloudserver if grep -q galera_gcache_size ${USER_VARS_PATH}; then sed -i 's/galera_gcache_size:.*/galera_gcache_size: 50M/' else echo 'galera_gcache_size: 50M' >> ${USER_VARS_PATH} fi
deleted_lines: # Generate the passwords

commit_message:
Remove harcoded deployment mode in vCenter tests

I changed harcoded deployment mode in vCenter tests on
DEPLOYMENT_MODE, rename tests and added the 'ha' test
to OSTF.

Change-Id: I19992e0f207cf0f49e492768cc51f3c05080051e
Related-Bug: #1417103

subject: Enable tempest scenarios for aio
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-17 07:08:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/db75eda6ccfa4aa18d346e45feddd645d2ef4425', 'message': 'Enable tempest scenarios for aio

This patch updates the tempest resources play to create all the
pre-requistes for running the commit_aio tempest tests.  This is
currently test_minimum_basic and test_swift_basic_ops.
Also defaults gate-check-commit RUN_TEMPEST and DEPLOY_TEMPEST variables
to yes.

Co-Authored-By: Hugh Saunders <hugh@wherenow.org>
Closes-Bug: #1419094
Change-Id: Ib92b30f040cf05202d7785c8a3132150d31ef92e
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-17 14:01:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/877c57c4ebd5bc13b21053d63ee75e5548a9c29b', 'message': 'Enable tempest scenarios for aio

This patch updates the tempest resources play to create all the
pre-requistes for running the commit_aio tempest tests.  This is
currently test_minimum_basic and test_swift_basic_ops.
Also defaults gate-check-commit RUN_TEMPEST and DEPLOY_TEMPEST variables
to yes.

Several other improvements were required to get tempest to run.
* The AIO interfaces file was changed to allow for proper networking of
  a flat network within an environment.
* ml2_conf.ini a variable was added to override an assumed network
  interface on a physical host.
* rpc_tempest_gate.sh was updated to allow for commit_aio testing.
* The gate scripts were update to support running tempest. in the
  environment.

commit_message:
Enable tempest scenarios for aio

This patch updates the tempest resources play to create all the
pre-requistes for running the commit_aio tempest tests.  This is
currently test_minimum_basic and test_swift_basic_ops.
Also defaults gate-check-commit RUN_TEMPEST and DEPLOY_TEMPEST variables
to yes.

Several other improvements were required to get tempest to run.
* The AIO interfaces file was changed to allow for proper networking of
  a flat network within an environment.
* ml2_conf.ini a variable was added to override an assumed network
  interface on a physical host.
* rpc_tempest_gate.sh was updated to allow for commit_aio testing.
* The gate scripts were update to support running tempest. in the
  environment.

Co-Authored-By: Hugh Saunders <hugh@wherenow.org>
Closes-Bug: #1419094
Change-Id: Ib92b30f040cf05202d7785c8a3132150d31ef92e

commit_message:
For plugins package version 2.0.0 use different data path

To make paths to deployment scripts and repositories
full name of the plugin is used for old plugins, i.e.
"plugin_name-1.2.3", for new plugins with package version
2.0.0 new only name and major version is used, because
during the installation plugin is put in different
directory "plugin_name-1.2".

Also there is additional fix for test to fix "100" < "99"
sorting problem.

Implements: blueprint plugins-security-fixes-delivery
Change-Id: I1711eff50a3d9612cb6d31af492b18356087e438

commit_message:
Overwrite default /etc/apt/sources.list

By default this file contains all kinds of repo, which breaks
apt-get update, therefore it should be overwritten before deployment

related to blueprint granular-deployment-based-on-tasks

Change-Id: Idd0fae9b63aebf265d75a56003ba55d58b1f9878

Using of waitpid system call was optimized

blocking waitpid system call.

commit_message:
Version for tests added

Fuel releases versions compatibility now included into tests discovering
mechanism.

Change-Id: Ia860cc62d30ef02e7fdff4864eecd16cccf01b1c
Implements: blueprint ostf-tests-versioning

subject: Remove the tempest glusterfs job
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-19 00:39:19.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/bdca95a48c725339d74084919c7bbe78d8a129de', 'message': 'Remove the tempest glusterfs job

This partway through the tempest runs in this jobs the nodes seem to
lose connection with jenkins resulting in zuul restarting the job. This
means these jobs are just restarted over and over and over again. Stop
running these jobs until this is corrected.

Change-Id: Ie515d6d940767c28b774d65b9f8ae64314454e6b
'}]
commit_message:
Remove the tempest glusterfs job

This partway through the tempest runs in this jobs the nodes seem to
lose connection with jenkins resulting in zuul restarting the job. This
means these jobs are just restarted over and over and over again. Stop
running these jobs until this is corrected.

Change-Id: Ie515d6d940767c28b774d65b9f8ae64314454e6b

commit_message:
Implement group related methods for LDAP backend

This patch implements three functions, empty in the LDAP backend,
which are necessary to obtain information about groups,
such as roles, projects and domains of the groups.

These are the functions:

- get_roles_for_groups
- list_projects_for_groups
- list_domains_for_groups

Change-Id: I0020a1a78004cfca1bcec40ecc938d3e2362dba8
Closes-Bug: #1333712

commit_message:
Split resource_setup for limit tests

Split up the resource_setup method for the compute limit tests, per the
latest spec.

Partially-implements bp:resource-cleanup

Change-Id: Idcd56f6cf8127f41863c5f9335272503888d2cc8

commit_message:
Add check on swift rings health

- Add check that swift rings balance value is equal
to 0 to all ha neutron and nova tests

commit_message:
Added --tenant option for keystone authentication

We had 'admin' tenant hardcoded, while for notifications we want other
tenants to be allowed to do notifications via the CLI.

DocImpact
Related-Bug: #1371757

Change-Id: I26399a62440710b63d8fec94213700fb03ab66e8

commit_message:
fuel_upgrade: add retries for getting token

After starting a new Keystone container, the first attempt to get a token
fails. Unfortunately, the logs keep silent and say nothing. As a
workaround, we can just increase retries number.

(cherry picked from commit 81e01c06420db7289f1efaaf8eddf172b61dca45)

Change-Id: Ib1bba120614d1964e838c289489f1877074c324d
Closes-Bug: #1403798
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/74/156574/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: with mock.patch('fuel_upgrade.utils.time.time') as time: # Unfortunately, in Python 2.6 the itertools.count() doesn't # support the step argument, so we need to implement our own # bicycle. def timestamp(start, step): x = start while True: yield x x += step # We need such infinity generator, because time.time() is used # by our loggers, so we can't predict how often it will be called. time.side_effect = timestamp(0, 15) self.keystone.request self.assertEqual(self.keystone.get_token(), None)
deleted_lines: self.keystone.request self.assertEqual(self.keystone.get_token(), None)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-13 07:48:54.000000000', 'files': ['lib/databases/mysql', 'lib/database', 'lib/databases/postgresql'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/2aa7561547157c497c721710a4d555be69b2ef65', 'message': 'Increase mysql/mariadb max-connection

Jobs are failing with "OperationalError" "Too many connections",
error messages.

The postgresql default max connection (100) is already increased to 200,
because of gate issues.

This change increases the default mysql(151) to 200, by using the
same the MAX_DB_CONNECTION environment variable as used
with postgresql.

Change-Id: Ia8308dcaa3a6555a303b0991b8bf6873cc553096
'}]
commit_message:
Increase mysql/mariadb max-connection

Jobs are failing with "OperationalError" "Too many connections",
error messages.

The postgresql default max connection (100) is already increased to 200,
because of gate issues.

This change increases the default mysql(151) to 200, by using the
same the MAX_DB_CONNECTION environment variable as used
with postgresql.

Change-Id: Ia8308dcaa3a6555a303b0991b8bf6873cc553096
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/89/146789/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: # - DATABASE_{HOST,USER,PASSWORD} must be definedMAX_DB_CONNECTIONS=${MAX_DB_CONNECTIONS:-200}

commit_message:
Updates the global requirements to the latest stable/icehouse

This change updates the icehouse global requirements to the latest stable/icehouse
which resolves a number of errors that occur due to python packages not containing
upper and lower boundries.

This will resolve the critical bug where eventlet breaks nova due to incompatibilities
in version >= 16.0.

Change-Id: I6ce3b782b0b030b1023d0201da1b673b328eec99
Closes-Bug: 1419453

commit_message:
Updated the git_repo values to point to github

This commit resolves the issue where git.openstack.org becomes unavailable
due to rate limiting. This cause instability when deploying 9.x and effects
existing and new builds.

Change-Id: Idb6f8fc2aa42ffb6ec71876e7fbc0114eefc87cc
Closes-Bug: #1423409

commit_message:
Fix OS action client initialization

 * Fix work with trust-scoped token
 * Fix NovaAction and KeystoneAction
 * Added new field to MistralContext - is_trust_scoped

Change-Id: Id1a8c959ffd07032f9ab03e5fdbafbdc66374ce3

commit_message:
Fix static strings with labels for DVR

There are couple of static strings introduced for
DVR configuration such as the L3 agent mode.

This patch would clean up the static strings with
the labels.

Closes-Bug: #1411351
Change-Id: I143262e62ee994e6c01d63e4ea7d5f6292de8286

commit_message:
Added script to move all functional tests to TestRail

This script allows to add the information about
all automated tests in Tempest and all functional
tests in OpenStack projects repositories to TestRail.

Closes-Bug: #1422377
Change-Id: Ic7aae59287636793e4f4154dbfc910e81343072a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/20/155820/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2015 Mirantis, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import subprocess from settings import logger from settings import TestRailSettings from testrail_client import TestRailProject def generate_groups(line): groups = [] if 'compute' in line: groups.append('nova') if 'image' in line: groups.append('glance') if 'orchestration' in line or 'heat' in line: groups.append('heat') if 'baremetal' in line: groups.append('ironic') if 'data_processing' in line: groups.append('sahara') if 'database' in line: groups.append('database') if 'identity' in line: groups.append('keystone') if 'messaging' in line: groups.append('messaging') if 'network' in line: groups.append('network') if 'object_storage' in line: groups.append('object_storage') if 'telemetry' in line: groups.append('ceilometer') if 'volume' in line: groups.append('cinder') if 'scenario' in line: groups.append('scenarios') if 'stress' in line: groups.append('stress') return groups def get_tests_descriptions(milestone_id, tests_include, tests_exclude): tests = [] tempest_cmd = """rm -rf tempest && \\ git clone https://github.com/openstack/tempest && \\ cd tempest/tempest && egrep -r \"def test\" ./* """ for t in [{"suite": "Tempest", "cmd": tempest_cmd}, ]: p = subprocess.Popen(t["cmd"], shell=True, stdout=subprocess.PIPE, stderr=subprocess.PIPE) for line in iter(p.stdout.readline, b''): if 'test' in line: groups = generate_groups(line) if len(groups) == 0: print line title = line.replace(" def ", "", 5) title = title.replace(".py: ", ":", 5) title = "".join(title.split()).split('(')[0].split(':')[1] title = title.replace(" ", "") title = title.replace(".", "") title = title.replace("/", "_") steps = [{"run this tempest test": "pass"}, ] tc_title = "[%s] " % t["suite"] for group in groups: tc_title = tc_title + "[" + group + "] " test_case = { "title": tc_title + title, "type_id": 1, "priority_id": 5, "estimate": "1m", "refs": "", "custom_test_group": "Tempest", "custom_test_case_description": title.replace("_", " "), "custom_test_case_steps": steps } tests.append(test_case) return tests def upload_tests_descriptions(testrail_project, section_id, tests): existing_cases = [case['custom_test_group'] for case in testrail_project.get_cases(TestRailSettings.test_suite, section_id=section_id)] for test_case in tests: if test_case['custom_test_group'] in existing_cases: logger.debug('Skipping uploading "{0}" test case because it ' 'already exists in "{1}" tests section.'.format( test_case['custom_test_group'], TestRailSettings.test_suite)) continue logger.debug('Uploading test "{0}" to TestRail project "{1}", ' 'suite "{2}", section "{3}"'.format( test_case["custom_test_group"], TestRailSettings.project, TestRailSettings.test_suite, TestRailSettings.test_section)) testrail_project.add_case(section_id=section_id, case=test_case) def main(): print TestRailSettings.user print TestRailSettings.password testrail_project = TestRailProject( url=TestRailSettings.url, user=TestRailSettings.user, password=TestRailSettings.password, project=TestRailSettings.project ) testrail_section = testrail_project.get_section_by_name( suite=TestRailSettings.test_suite, section_name=TestRailSettings.test_section ) testrail_milestone = testrail_project.get_milestone( name=TestRailSettings.milestone)['id'] tests_descriptions = get_tests_descriptions( milestone_id=testrail_milestone, tests_include=TestRailSettings.test_include, tests_exclude=TestRailSettings.test_exclude ) upload_tests_descriptions(testrail_project=testrail_project, section_id=testrail_section['id'], tests=tests_descriptions) if __name__ == '__main__': main()

commit_message:
Remove nsenter docker image

nsenter via docker container was never properly
implemented for docker with native exec driver.
It can be safely removed.

blueprint fuel-master-docker-upgrade

Change-Id: I5286c60530ea422527024fc099fe877c3962165b

commit_message:
Remove docker intermediary containers during build

These containers cannot be deleted safely sometimes
and are not needed, so it is best to purge them
in every case when building docker images.

Change-Id: I333685f1e8d21b74ce068dde0b9487adfc4961b7
Closes-Bug: #141578

commit_message:
Add insecure parameter

The following parameter is added

  --insecure

which allows to access swift servers without checking SSL certs
The servers certificate will not be verified

Change-Id: I2c89986974dcb285293a6480d07e578a52779386
Implements: blueprint allow-insecure-swift-param

commit_message:
Switch nova.api.* to use instance dot notation

nova.compute.manager should use instance objects with the field
access dot notation everywhere. Essentially we use instance.key
instead of instance['key']. Also switch on want_objects=True in
calls to compute_api.get().

Change-Id: Idfdaeb60ecbcc0d8ae082ed471c58868f3d621a8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/76/156076/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: server[key] = instance.node
deleted_lines: server[key] = instance['node']

commit_message:
Update compute base test to split up resource_setup

Per the bp, split out skip checks and setup for clients and
credentials from resource_setup.

Partially-implements bp:resource-cleanup

Change-Id: Ic82b4a5a773a6a611adcc2946cee1d0ecb100ca9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/24/141424/29 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @classmethod def skip_checks(cls): super(BaseComputeTest, cls).skip_checks() if cls._api_version == 3: if not CONF.compute_feature_enabled.api_v3: skip_msg = ("%s skipped as nova v3 api is not available" % cls.__name__) raise cls.skipException(skip_msg) elif cls._api_version != 2: msg = ("Unexpected API version is specified (%s)" % cls._api_version) raise exceptions.InvalidConfiguration(message=msg) @classmethod def setup_credentials(cls): super(BaseComputeTest, cls).setup_credentials() # TODO(andreaf) WE should care also for the alt_manager here # but only once client lazy load in the manager is done cls.os = cls.get_client_manager() cls.multi_user = cls.check_multi_user() @classmethod def setup_clients(cls): super(BaseComputeTest, cls).setup_clients() def setup_credentials(cls): super(BaseComputeAdminTest, cls).setup_credentials() @classmethod def setup_clients(cls): super(BaseComputeAdminTest, cls).setup_clients()
deleted_lines: # TODO(andreaf) WE should care also for the alt_manager here # but only once client lazy load in the manager is done cls.os = cls.get_client_manager() cls.multi_user = cls.check_multi_user() if not CONF.compute_feature_enabled.api_v3: skip_msg = ("%s skipped as nova v3 api is not available" % cls.__name__) raise cls.skipException(skip_msg) else: msg = ("Unexpected API version is specified (%s)" % cls._api_version) raise exceptions.InvalidConfiguration(message=msg) def resource_setup(cls): super(BaseComputeAdminTest, cls).resource_setup()

commit_message:
Remove swift monitoring from maas_local playbook

Swift MaaS is setup in the swift_maas.yml playbook, removing the
duplicates from maas_local which were incorrect and unrequired.

Change-Id: I967b7bba387b8ce6994dad5b63c176328395df55
Closes-Bug: #1421665

subject: bug fix:response code 201 in SLO conflict case
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-19 09:02:39.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/middleware/slo.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_slo.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/74100239bb208de8e970bb9bf2bd930063689466', 'message': 'bug fix:response code 201 in SLO conflict case

In Swift 2.2.2.post37

One can request PUT with response code "201 Created" a manifest file such as :

[{"path" : "container/segment_object_00", "etag" : "<etag of segment_object_00>", "size_bytes" : <size of segment_object_00>},
{"path" : "container/segment_object_01", "etag" : "<etag of segment_object_01>", "size_bytes" : <size of segment_object_01>},
{"path" : "container/segment_object_02", "etag" : "<etag of segment_object_02>", "size_bytes" : <size of segment_object_02>}]

with command such as :

$curl -X PUT -H 'X-Auth-Token:AUTH_<auth_token>' -H 'Content-Length : <length of manifest>' --upload-file manifest_file http://localhost:8080/v1/AUTH_account/container/segment_object_00?multipart-manifest=put

And when one requests GET SLO with command such as :

$curl -X GET -H 'X-Auth-Token:AUTH_<auth_token>' http://localhost:8080/v1/AUTH_account/container/segment_object_00

, the response code is "409 Conflict".

I think Swift should respond "409 Conflict" when client PUT manifest whose path is included in the manifest.

Change-Id: I29d7cd8d3b9345eb767a1ab590824b5dd2302227
Closes-Bug: 1417936
'}]
commit_message:
bug fix:response code 201 in SLO conflict case

In Swift 2.2.2.post37

One can request PUT with response code "201 Created" a manifest file such as :

[{"path" : "container/segment_object_00", "etag" : "<etag of segment_object_00>", "size_bytes" : <size of segment_object_00>},
{"path" : "container/segment_object_01", "etag" : "<etag of segment_object_01>", "size_bytes" : <size of segment_object_01>},
{"path" : "container/segment_object_02", "etag" : "<etag of segment_object_02>", "size_bytes" : <size of segment_object_02>}]

with command such as :

$curl -X PUT -H 'X-Auth-Token:AUTH_<auth_token>' -H 'Content-Length : <length of manifest>' --upload-file manifest_file http://localhost:8080/v1/AUTH_account/container/segment_object_00?multipart-manifest=put

And when one requests GET SLO with command such as :

$curl -X GET -H 'X-Auth-Token:AUTH_<auth_token>' http://localhost:8080/v1/AUTH_account/container/segment_object_00

, the response code is "409 Conflict".

I think Swift should respond "409 Conflict" when client PUT manifest whose path is included in the manifest.

Change-Id: I29d7cd8d3b9345eb767a1ab590824b5dd2302227
Closes-Bug: 1417936

commit_message:
Update cinder $manage_volume condition for cinder VMDK

$manage_volume condition was improperly checking for the cinder role to
 deploy cinder-volume to. We need to deploy cinder-volume the same way
 as we do for ceph

add host param to cinder backend vmkd as it happens is
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/157004/

Change-Id: I9f615b88f6d22a902ed93f7a6e1eb84803991b34
Closes-Bug: 1410517

commit_message:
Update cinder $manage_volume condition for cinder VMDK

$manage_volume condition was improperly checking for the cinder role to
 deploy cinder-volume to. We need to deploy cinder-volume the same way
 as we do for ceph

add host param to cinder backend vmkd so that duplicate locations can be
 accessed when down, a more comprehensive commit is being proposed upstream
 for the same.

Change-Id: I9f615b88f6d22a902ed93f7a6e1eb84803991b34
Closes-Bug: 1410517

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-specs refs/changes/04/152304/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode .. This template should be in ReSTructured text. The filename in the git repository should match the launchpad URL, for example a URL of https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/awesome-thing should be named awesome-thing.rst . Please do not delete any of the sections in this template. If you have nothing to say for a whole section, just write: None For help with syntax, see http://sphinx-doc.org/rest.html To test out your formatting, see http://www.tele3.cz/jbar/rest/rest.html ============================= Internal oslo.messaging bus for convergence ============================= Include the URL of your launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/convergence-message-bus Problem description =================== We need a message bus for the internal worker API of convergence. Proposed change =============== Create a new worker service within heat-engine that is dedicated to handling internal messages to the 'worker' (a.k.a. 'converger') actor in convergence. Messages on this bus will use the 'cast' rather than 'call' method to anycast the message to an engine that will handle it asynchronously. We won't wait for or expect replies from these messages. The message types that will eventually be implemented on this bus are those marked with the @asynchronous decorator in https://github.com/zaneb/heat-convergence-prototype/blob/resumable/converge/converger.py Alternatives ------------ We could have a separate heat-worker daemon, but there appears to be no point in making life difficult for deployers as heat-engine can handle the same tasks. We could mix this into the same service as the existing RPC API that is called by heat-api, but this is messy because the two have entirely different uses. There is already precedent for running another RPC service inside heat-engine, although we can't reuse that because it listens on a queue specific to the engine id. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: kanagaraj-manickam Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: Kilo-3 Work Items ---------- - Implement the new worker service in the engine - Implement a client API to make it easy to send messages to the worker service Dependencies ============ None

Push instead of pull resource input data

Change-Id: Ice47938b9a5229f3d5f723b99eb6cb023f0d7fe7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-specs refs/changes/03/152303/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode .. This template should be in ReSTructured text. The filename in the git repository should match the launchpad URL, for example a URL of https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/awesome-thing should be named awesome-thing.rst . Please do not delete any of the sections in this template. If you have nothing to say for a whole section, just write: None For help with syntax, see http://sphinx-doc.org/rest.html To test out your formatting, see http://www.tele3.cz/jbar/rest/rest.html ============================= Extract data from resources to push into dependencies ============================= Include the URL of your launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/convergence-push-data Problem description =================== We currently assume that every resource in a stack is loaded in memory concurrently, and we query it directly to determine its attribute values. This 'pull' system is inefficient in the convergence architechture compared to a 'push' system, since we hope to typically have only one resource loaded in memory at a time. Proposed change =============== Analyse the template to determine which attributes of a resource are needed elsewhere. This is conceptually quite similar to the way we analyse the template looking for dependencies, except with the addition of attribute names. This must be implemented in such a way that it can work with arbitrary template format plugins, and will probably require a change to the Function plugin API. After a create or update event, we can use this list of attributes to query the resource for all of the information that will be needed subsequently from it. Alternatives ------------ Load a resource from the database whenever we need to retrieve one of its attributes. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: skraynev Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: Kilo-3 Work Items ---------- - Determine the list of attributes of a resource which are referenced in the template Dependencies ============ None

commit_message:
Added handling of mclient_remove parameter

If mclient_remove parameter is set to false for a node, it causes mcollective
client not to be called for this node. This is because we want to be able to
forcefuly delete offline nodes and without this parameter Astute keeps
retrying deletion for a long time.
If mclient_remove is not specified for node, it is treated as true by default
thus preserving backwards compatibility.

Implements blueprint: node-removal-task

Change-Id: I256ebdb731a405897192f37b874c6d4f785e3e45
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-astute refs/changes/92/155692/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # When :mclient_remove property is true (the default behavior), we send # the node to mclient for removal (MBR, restarting etc), if it's false # the node is skipped from mclient def skipped_unskipped_mclient_nodes(nodes) mclient_skipped_nodes = NodesHash.build( nodes.values.select { |node| not node.fetch(:mclient_remove, true) } ) mclient_nodes = NodesHash.build( nodes.values.select { |node| node.fetch(:mclient_remove, true) } ) Astute.logger.debug "#{@ctx.task_id}: Split nodes: #{mclient_skipped_nodes}, #{mclient_nodes}" [mclient_skipped_nodes, mclient_nodes] end erased_nodes, mclient_nodes = skipped_unskipped_mclient_nodes(nodes) responses = mclient_remove_nodes(mclient_nodes) inaccessible_uids = mclient_nodes.uids - responses.map { |response| response[:sender] }
deleted_lines: responses = mclient_remove_nodes(nodes) inaccessible_uids = nodes.uids - responses.map { |response| response[:sender] } erased_nodes = NodesHash.new

commit_message:
Remove misleading message about pids

If puppet failed and pid did not remove,
but actual process already finished
we show message:

    "Looks like expecting puppet and actual are different"

Now we will show it only if we have different between
running actual and pid from file.

Change-Id: I74b3d280329f98fd064a78a91024001a948ef6c1
Related-Bug: #1422364
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-astute refs/changes/55/156555/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: reply[:err_msg] = "Potencial error. Looks like expecting puppet " \ "and actual are different. Expecting pid(lockfile): " \ "#{expected_pid}, actual(ps): #{actual_pid}" if actual_pid
deleted_lines: reply[:err_msg] = "Potencial error. Looks like expecting puppet and actual are different. " \ "Expecting pid(lockfile): #{expected_pid}, actual(ps): #{actual_pid}"

commit_message:
Enable super-on-old-class pylint check

.. and disable the check locally for two midonet and Ryu classes that
fail since the midonet/ryu libraries are unavailable in our toxenv.
